name: Lindens
address: 2 Renwick St, New York, NY 10013, USA

reviews.text: Best pancakes ever. Period. Is a really great place for breakfast, we loved the pancakes, they have a mascarpone cream on top with wild berries that make a difference. The coffee was great too. You should really try it.
Do you want more 5-star Google reviews? Best of all, they‚Äôre free! We can provide as many as you need to help your business reach the top of Google Maps. Contact us on Telegram: @gthisjpeg
The food was delicious but the service took forever but it was worth the wait because the shoestring fries were scrumptious
Its was 5/5 i would recommend üëç
They have incredible food and a good environment.I had fun eating their delicious food.
My friend and I are regulars here. We come all the way from westchester. The only flaw is they got rid of the basil Palomas üò≠ üò≠

I had the  Hamachi and the Hanger steak, both absolutely delicious ... though I could have done with slightly larger portions. Service was excellent. Looking for the hair in the soup, I'd mention the atmosphere ... too chilled (HVAC) for my taste ... on the other hand it was not too crowded so not noisy and service was very attentive

Lepi ljuti
ukusi i fino osoblje krase ovaj restoran

The experience was just okay. We had a table for ten and ordered wine, but ended up pouring it ourselves and waiting quite a while for service. The food was nothing special ‚Äî the steak lacked flavor, and the Beyond Burger was burnt (the server said that was normal). The cheeseburger was good but tasted like a regular slider and came without fries. Overall, a bit overpriced for what it‚Äôs worth.
Very nice

Waitress was great, food was ok, was too expensive vs quality (eg $25 - pre tax and tip - for a watered down Campari spritz). Also they did not course our meal as we requested (we asked to bring everything at once) but that seemed like a miss for the kitchen vs front of house.
Macky was great! Very attentive, fun and has a great memory!

I had such an incredible experience at Lindens! Fran, the bartender/mixologist, was absolutely amazing ‚Äî so patient and thoughtful in helping me choose a drink. I went with the Shishito Julep, and it was perfect.

The food was out of this world. The sausage breakfast sandwich, citrus salad, and summer carrot ravioli were all phenomenal ‚Äî the ravioli especially was the perfect balance of savory, herby, buttery, silken goodness with that touch of pancetta. And you must try the fresh-baked bread loaf with herb butter‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs heavenly.

The vibe here is just as great as the food: farm-to-table freshness, a warm atmosphere, and staff that feel friendly in a way that‚Äôs almost familiar, like you‚Äôve known them forever. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!
Arrived during Happy Hour...stayed for dinner. Perfect spot to hop into when in the area.
Every thing is good. Get the bees knees cocktail and the carrot ravioli.
Franny is tremendous. Good conversation. Good food.
Freyn was an excellent host!

Rushed through our entire dinner. Our reservation was for 9:30, we were literally kicked out by 10:45 without a warning. Don‚Äôt make reservations available at 9:30 if you can‚Äôt commit to serving it properly. Food was good though.
Wow, awesome breakfast! And that was "thick" cut bacon !ü•ì!
Polenta & mushrooms yum! Coffee just ok but food was wonderful.

Even though I had asked for medium, steak was undercooked (rare) and ended up getting sick later that night. Wait time for food was insane. Oysters were horrible! Not fresh at all. Chocolate chip cookies were amazing but I wouldn‚Äôt come for anything else.
Lovely place, good food, great service. I had the crispy chicken, and it was really good.
Fran was amazing - delicious cocktails perfectly balanced!
The food was well presented...and delicious! The two of us had a great evening.
Love the outdoor dinner here. Amazing foods and great service by Levi! Highly recommend!!

Mackie was the best waiter ive ever had in my entire life. My experience here was so insanely good. Will come back here for my wedding Mackie was the best waiter ever. I don‚Äôt even know how to explain it!!!!!!!
Maki was great
Mackey was incredible!!!
Maki was amazing, so kind and such a great server

We had a great early dinner on a warm Friday night. Our server Macky was charming, confident and attentive. He went thru the menu pointing out must haves and he wasn‚Äôt wrong - we had a delicious meal and the food came out quick! Get the raspberry ginger ale - so good! We were too full to get dessert but still were served an aperitif. Looking forward to coming back soon!

The corn and bacon pizza is AMAZING! The fries were delish as well. But even better is the service - shoutout to William, who went above and beyond üò≠ thank you for supporting my family‚Äôs small business. Also thank you to Islam! Great guys, great energy.
Do not miss the fries on any account.
Gabriel was a fantastic bartender. The cocktails were amazing. Highly recommend the Lavender Daisy

An unexpected Gem.  Went here last night for a business dinner where someone else picked the venue, so I walked in with zero expectations.  First of all the service was excellent.  I wish I had caught the name of the gentleman who served our table, but he was phenomenal, attentive, and deeply knowledgeable of the menu.  All the food was very well done.  Simple dishes with very high quality ingredients, executed perfectly.  But a couple absolutely stood out.  The porter house rolls with chived butter, the Hamachi and the crispy chicken paillard were fantastic.  I would argue that the chicken was the best schnitzelled chicken I have had in the US, paper thin, and perfectly fried.

I would give 10 stars for service to the bartender Fran if I could. I was dining on my own and she was super friendly. Good conversation, great service and great food. Try the cheeseburger. It‚Äôs to die for!
Fran at the bar was wonderful! Drinks were delicious and Fran was kind & friendly. We enjoyed our experience very much!
Fran was great!
Fran was amazing!!
Bartender Fran was professional, friendly, and fast.
Extremely kind and helpful stuff with a great menu and quality food at a fair price
We have a great time the service was really good they are very kind and nice, the food was fire thanks to fran, Jose and Michael we definitely want to come back :)

Hopped in for a cocktail and had a great time. While sitting at the bar, the bar tender Fran did an awesome job. She made delicious cocktails and always had an eye if I needed anything. World class service

The outdoor courtyard is beautiful and the service is amazing! We went for brunch, and while the menu is a little smaller, the food was great but the service was even better! Truly loved our experience here!
Food, service and ambiance was 10/10. Shout-out to Levi - who was our server and rocked!
Fran is great!

The burger and fries are the best in NYC!! The burger melts in your mouth and the fries are shoe string with an incredible truffle mayo‚Ä¶YUM!!!! Macky was also so sweet and so attentive. Will DEFINITELY be back!
truly incredible service (shoutout to macky) and loved the outside atmosphere!
Macky is the BEST! He was so friendly, checked up on us frequently, funny. Very nice experience.
Dian is amazing!!! He rocks so much!!!! Would recommend 100% He is a star and a gem and great singing voice of happy birthday
Love Dian! Amazing service - he is so kind and made our experience amazing.

We normally do not frequent hotel restaurants as the menu is either limited or not of top quality.

This is NOT the case for Lindens.  A must go for atmosphere, service, and quality.

Whether a date, a business meeting or a large group fun-time out, this place is recommended.

It‚Äôs not on a main street and out of the way from other business‚Ä¶.hidden on a side street.

Really nice place! Just quite loud on the inside. The prices are fair and the food is good. We had peaches and broccoli for entree, cheeseburger and chicken for main dishes. We didn‚Äôt have dessert as we didn‚Äôt see anything special.

Went in for breakfast and it was fantastic. Named after the Linden trees that line New York‚Äôs streets, this modern American restaurant is ‚Äònice‚Äô.. not cheap but worth it given quality of ingredients

Got the three egg omelet but scrambled. Came with goat cheese, caramelized onion, parsley.. and it was AMAZING. The best part? The house made slightly spicy lamb andouille sausage. WOW.

Fresh squeezed orange juice was tasty. But tiny!

A Hidden Gem with Burgers Worth Writing Home About

Tucked away in the heart of the city, Linden‚Äôs American Restaurant isn‚Äôt just another spot trying to slap ‚Äúgourmet‚Äù on its menu ‚Äî it means it. From the moment you walk in, there‚Äôs a cozy yet confident vibe that makes you feel like you‚Äôve discovered something special. But let‚Äôs cut to the chase: the food is where Linden‚Äôs really shows off.

First up: the burger. This isn‚Äôt your average patty-on-a-bun situation. We‚Äôre talking perfectly seared, juicy beef that‚Äôs seasoned like someone in the kitchen really cares. The bun is soft but holds its own, and every topping ‚Äî from the melty cheese to the tangy house-made sauce ‚Äî adds something real to the bite. It‚Äôs the kind of burger that demands your full attention. And yes, you will find yourself thinking about it later.

Now, let‚Äôs talk fries. These golden beauties come out hot, crisp, and salted just right ‚Äî none of that soggy, over-seasoned nonsense. They‚Äôre the kind of fries that dare you not to finish the whole plate before your main even hits the table.

And then there‚Äôs the steak ‚Äî tender, flavorful, and cooked to that perfect balance where it practically melts in your mouth. It‚Äôs clear Linden‚Äôs isn‚Äôt cutting corners; everything from the quality of the cut to the way it‚Äôs plated shows care and craft.

Whether you‚Äôre looking for a casual dinner or showing a friend your new favorite spot, Linden‚Äôs hits that sweet spot between comfort and class. Go for the burger, stay for the steak, and don‚Äôt even try to skip the fries ‚Äî trust me.

A pretty good experience, I would say borderline 5 stars to me given the price. The fig punch cocktail was amazing all the way from the way it was served to the flavours. Orange marmalade sangria was not as much to my taste unfortunately and the flavour was not as rich as I expected. The cheeseburger was very solid. It was perfectly balanced and they added some spicy elements to it too - definitely a very good one. The French fries were good although a bit salty to me. The truffle aioli was great. The portion size was super large! Overall the food was good but it had pretty straightforward taste. So definitely this place serves good basic food but I personally did not find anything special. The staff members were really welcoming and polite.

Came here for the 3rd time for lunch with some colleagues. Bright and airy setting, delicious food, and strong drinks. Really liked the margarita, could‚Äôve been even spicier. They also have comfortable seats. And a gorgeous outdoor seating area.

Beautiful outdoor patio. Great food- my friend and I had fries, the ravioli, and pancakes. Service was a little slow-had to ask twice for my drink and napkin was a little dirty. Waiter was nice and brought over an umbrella without being asked since it was very sunny and warm. All in all, a great spot for a nice brunch!

Cool outdoor seating, good food and cheerful service. Though my steak contained gristle, my glass of wine didn't arrive with the meal - i had to get up, find, and corner the waitstaff. The green onions were too tough to cut with a steak knife and splitting the bill was more problematic than it should have been.

Downgrading the service because they charged the whole dinner to one xard, despite us all signing bills for individual amounts, skdting it out after the visit is painful.

UPDATE 1: The restaurant ignored the phone calls from the 1 member of our party tgat was charged the whole bill. Atrocious service. They should be ashamed of themselves.

UPDATE 2: On July 26th I wrote to Gary with details of event and name of customer they'd overcharged without permission on July 26th. He hasn't replied yet. I'm not holding my breath!!!!

Really loved everything about Lindens. It's the restaurant within the Arlo SoHo hotel which is also accessible to non-guests. We went for breakfast after checking out.

Upon walking in, the customer service was great. The hostess greeted us kindly and seated us quickly. Though a server was not readily available, the manager, Terrell, stepped in to assist and made sure we were taken care of.

After ordering, the food came fairly quickly. I got the sausage(lamb), egg and cheese sandwich and I really can't say enough good things about it. 10 stars.

Everyone we encountered delivered great service. Would 100% visit again.

As heads up, the online dinner menu is showing outdated prices. ie. the oyster mushroom was 14$ online and 20$ at the restaurant.

Aside of that, we had a great dinner, really enjoyed the house rolls, striped bass and warm plate of cookies. Jasmine was a fun and friendly server, went above and beyond, didn't rush us and was kind enough to provide two cups for the floral fig cocktail/give us good recommendations for dessert.

I also recommend the cauliflower plate if vegetarian, it was crafted well, fun crispy textures from the quinoa and good use of herbs and spices for flavor. It was a memorable restaurant and would love to come visit again.

Decent restaurant in the neighborhood for some New American cuisine. Thought the oyster mushrooms were good, and the spicy sausage pizza and branzino to be above average and interesting dishes. Drinks here were unique and tasty.
Inside the Arlo hotel, Lindens was quite good. I really enjoyed my seasonal carrot tequila drink. The rolls are not worth it, but the impossible burger was very good. We enjoyed the crudo as well.

What a wonderful experience! So glad we chanced upon this restaurant while looking for lunch options in the area. The indoor part of the restaurant smelled so refreshing and almost magical. We got a table in the garden/open area in the back.
We came here for a birthday lunch and left very happy with the food and the service. We Ordered vegetarian options from the menu and everything was delicious. The fried mushrooms were just wow and so was the bread in the appetizer, the vegetarian pasta and vegan pizza. The service was impeccable, friendly and informative. The ambience was upscale yet very inviting and chill.
All in all we left quite satisfied and would like to return again. A little off the main streets but worth the visit.
I came here with a party of four, and had a great dinner: the steak and rolls were both delicious, and they made a refreshing mocktail.

A great find downtown near the holland tunnel. The delicata and artichoke tempura was an  excellent app! The burger was one of if not the best I‚Äôve ever had! Very popular is the squash ravioli. It was delicious but a little sweet. Our dirty martinis made to perfection with 3 large and delicious olives! I only gave 4 stars to the atmosphere bc it was a little loud inside but wouldn‚Äôt stop me from going again. Highly recommend and would definitely go back!

I just came in after work and sat at the bar ‚Äî it was exactly what I needed! I started with a mocktail, and to be honest, not every bar gets those right, but this one was really good. It was made by Gabriel, the bartender, who was super kind and friendly.

After that refreshing virgin mojito, I ordered the pomodoro pasta ‚Äî and I loved it! It had a bit of a kick, but the flavor was amazing. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back. Everyone here made the experience feel so welcoming!

We came here on a Friday night and the restaurant was at about 70% capacity. You could have probably walked in without a reservation. Overall the food and service were great, but the vibe of this spot was 3/5. It‚Äôs a nice neighborhood restaurant, but I wouldn‚Äôt travel far to check it out. I didn‚Äôt feel like it was great for dates, because the tables for two people were rectangular and the long end was facing my date. I felt like we had to talk loudly to hear each other. This spot may be good for last minute reservations for groups though.
Great food and service. Everything we ordered was absolutely delicious. The ambience is serious, calm and relaxing. if you want to eat good food, I would recomend this place.

This place is a fantastic restaurant! üç¥ Lindens in SoHo üóΩ offers a wonderful selection of incredibly delicious ü§§ dishes üçΩÔ∏è - definitely get the Crispy Oyster Mushroom üçÑ, Shoestring French Fries üçü, Half Chicken üçó, and Honeynut üçØ Squash Ravioli! Staff üë®‚Äçüç≥ is super friendly and professional, service is quick ‚è≤Ô∏è,  place is beautifully decorated üõãÔ∏è, and they have plenty of indoor seating. ü™ë I wish I knew about this place sooner!

Had a little girly brunch here and our server Jasmine was amazing!!! The breakfast sandwiches were 10/10 and the drinks are STRONG (in a good way). Loved the sausage egg and cheese and the dirty chai comes with a little cookie!! Everything was perfect.

Loved this restaurant! Never heard of it, but the reviews were really good, so decided to check it out. Nice atmosphere and service. We had the artichoke and squash tempura to start. For mains we had the butternut squash ravioli, the burger and fries. Tempura was 5/5. Ravioli 4/5 for me, but that's only because I don't care for the little bit of sweetness. But that's on me. I think you would love it if you're a fan of butternut squash. Fries were crispy and hot 5/5. The burger was honestly one of the BEST I've ever had. It seems simple, but wow it just works! 10/5.

Lindens is my favorite brunch spot in NYC. The restaurant is beautiful, the staff is excellent and friendly, and the food is great.
The natural light and design of the restaurant is beautiful and calming. The ambience is relaxed and upbeat.
The service is always friendly and professional. Levi was excellent!
The food is so good! The pancakes, the sausage/egg/cheese sandwich are great and the FRESH PRESSED PINEAPPLE JUICE is phenomenal.

Fantastic experience each time I‚Äôve come.

I‚Äôve eaten here for a few different times. Each time the food was made well. The server was kind and attentive. The atmosphere is relaxing. The cheeseburger with fries and the poached pear desert were my favorites! They have fresh squeezed juice and a nice selection of coffees, teas, and drinks. I recommend this place.

Solid place for a solid meal. Fresh ingredients and flavours that work well together. Subtle interior that makes for a relatively cozy night. Had branzino for main which was great. Our table ordered a lot of different appetizers to share and the best one was hamachi crudo

My husband and I spent Valentines Day at the Lindens! We were taken care of by my twin name ‚ÄúJasmine‚Äù! She was so helpful, kind, and accurate with her meal recommendations!

We will definitely come again! ‚ù£Ô∏è

A really lovely restaurant! Everything was fresh and delicious. Loved the heirloom carrot ravioli and the wine roasted cherries so much. Really pretty and airy space with indoor and backyard outdoor seating.
Macky was an excellent waiterand took very good care of our party.
Good stuff. One of the best breakfast I ever had. Loved the lemon ricotta avocado toast, pancakes and the brioche with the hashbrown. Would come back.

The food here is great! Levi served us who was super helpful and gave us some great recommendations. We had the bread to start was delicious, the butter makes it! The burger was amazing as well as the chicken. The fries were super thin and crispy too. This is a lovely place with a cool vibe and interior .

Good lunch spot with coworkers close to Tribeca area. Everyone liked the sharing items we got, especially the house roll and kale pita. My colleague really liked his gnocchi which was fluffy and crispy. The green bowl I got was a bit underwhelming with just mixed greens like a full salad. Service was attentive and efficient.

TLDR; this is a simple yet fine dine experience, great service and the food is delicious.

Linden‚Äôs is a chic and very simple restaurant that is beautifully accentuated by the decoration and wide open spaces. The food service is exceptional and the waiters are very knowledgeable and courteous. After every plate, we were brought new silverware and our table was wiped off. The waiters were very tentative to refill our glasses and would bring us another bottle of water promptly.

The food service was quick, we didn‚Äôt have to wait very long for it to come out nice and hot. We were here twice and ordered the pancakes, the avocado toast, the carrot ravioli, the giardiniera with pita bread, the burgers and the strawberry tart. All was super delicious and the waiters checked on us periodically to make sure that we were satisfied.

It was our anniversary and Isaiah (the manager) made it very special for my wife and I- the both times we visited! A very well spoken gentleman, made sure to check up on us throughout our visits. Definitely elevated the experience tenfold. We are very grateful for the wonderful service we received from Isaiah, our waiters and Zeury at the front desk. Zeury takes great pictures, loves taking them and she is just the sweetest! My wife loved her. We will definitely be returning in the near future.

Also, if you leave a note when making a reservation: they read EVERYTHING. This restaurant alone made our NY trip well worth it.

Great food - nice calm and quiet little restaurant near Pier 40!
Perfect for a little patio lunch or you can sit inside in their cute little seating area!
Ravioli was delicious
Spicy sausage pizza was a hit!

We had brunch on a Saturday and we chose to sit outside because the weather was so nice. The service was so good. Our waitress was so friendly and patient (we were with a small child and asked for an umbrella to cover us from the sun). We ordered a few things: salad, pasta, pizza, toast, and a√ßai bowl. All of them were so fresh and delicious. Somehow they just knew how to make good meal with a perfect balance of taste, texture, and temperature. All meals were worth the price. Seemed a bit high at first, but they were just so good. Would definitely recommend this restaurant!

FIVE STARS!! From the moment I walked in I was warmly greeted by Levi & Andres, I was given an awesome drink suggestion which was the *Bell pepper Sour* 10/10 beautifully crafted. On to my app I had the artichoke/zucchini tempura which was delightful. My Entree was the Sea Bass OMG it was exquisite!! Chefs Kiss üëåüèæ. The Menu is Pricey but worth it! I cannot wait to dine in again, customer service was top tier!

Came for dinner with a friend as this was a mutual location for a post work meet up and what pleasant experience. Arrived at 5:45 and it had a lot of availability‚Ä¶ by 7 ish it was packed! On a Tuesday! It smelled phenomenal thanks to the connected hotel.  Great ambiance, great service (attentive, great recommendations, great energy), DELICIOUS food!! Get the herb bread, fries, half chicken and the cookies lol. Friend had the raviolis and also did they were good! Had the Manhattan for my cocktail of choice and it had a nice kick. A sip slow kind of drink lol. Would def visit again!

Lindens is our absolute favorite restaurant in the city!! The atmosphere is wonderful, the servers are kind and attentive, and the food quality is incredible. Our favorite dishes include the seasonal ravioli, the shoestring fries with truffle aioli, the half chicken, and the steak. However, every dish we‚Äôve ever tried from Lindens has never disappointed us. Highly recommend if you‚Äôre in New York!

The vibe of this place was great.  Had reservations for 5:30 and sat upon arrival.  The staff weas attentive and friendly and the food, delicious!  Only downside is my stomach couldn't fit more!  lol

Gabby was our primary waitstaff but everyone kept an eye on the refil of beverages and removing empty plates.  I had the Hanger steak, cooked perfectly and the cookies and creme Brule were my favorite items.

Would love to come back and sit at the bar as the vibe there looked a bit more lively than our table eating.

I love the restaurant for their breakfast. For the healthier options, they had mixed berry salad and gluten-free avocado toast. The food tasted so fresh and delicious. The service was so great too. I recommend this place to everyone.

We were greeted by the warm, friendly host who went above and beyond to make my daughter‚Äôs birthday celebration extra special. Our server Dan was exceptional. He made great suggestions and brought each course out at the perfect time. My daughter was surprised withe birthday celebration. The food and service were impeccable. The restaurant atmosphere was warm, friendly and the decor was very nice. I highly recommend this place.

Lindens is a true culinary experience set in a very vibey ambiance. A friend and I sat in their outdoor area, which has strung lights, greenery and even a few private cabins. The menu had a lot of seasonal items, so everything was incredibly fresh. I also really appreciated their creative cocktail menu--it was separated into Herbal, Vegetal and Floral, with unexpected combinations and very cool pairings. Highly recommend the Parker Rolls, the Butternut Squash Ravioli, the Hanger Steak and the Oyster Sampler. Everything was DELICIOUS and the staff was really attentive and knowledgeable about the menu and ingredient lists. 10/10 recommend.

I don‚Äôt give 5 stars. This place is a real gem. I stopped in here casually for a quick Saturday brunch with my daughter. The decor is nice and the staff if ok. The food was absolutely heavenly. We tried the avocado toast and the a√ßa√≠ bowl. They were both delicious with fresh ingredients. My coffee with almond milk was also yum! Would definitely go back for something casual when in the hood. Prices are on the high side. Go!
